page.title: 07Local History of Malhamdale
page.content: There are stocks in{Airton}and{Kirkby {Malham}.In{Kirkby Malham}there is also the site of the dipping stool.In the churchyard is the base of a Saxon preaching cross.The church has a Norman font and a Jacobean table and chairs.The church was remodelled and the vicarage built in the mid 19th century by Walter Morrison,a local philanthropist who also built Kirkby Malham School. {Airton}still retains its village well and water pump. {Skellands farm}is the birthplace of James King who navigated on Captain Cook's 1st voyage to Australia. General John Lambert,Oliver Cromwell's second-in-command was born at{Calton {Hall}.In Kirkby Malham Church a chapel was dedicated to Lambert in May 1984.
